ğŸ¨ ACTIVITY MENU (YOU PICK!)

Indoor Activities (Any Time)

  1. LEGO Building - Build whatever you imagine!
  2. Drawing Station - All the art supplies you want
  3. Reading Corner - Pick any book from your shelf
  4. Dress-Up Box - Put on costumes and be whoever you want
  5. Building Blocks - Make towers, houses, or cities
  6. Play-Doh Time - Create and squish
  7. Puzzle Time - Work on puzzles together or alone
  8. Music Time - Play instruments, dance, sing

Outdoor Activities (When Weather Is Good)

  1. Park Adventure - Swings, slides, running around
  2. Nature Walk - Look for cool leaves, rocks, sticks
  3. Backyard Play - Run, play, explore
  4. Bike Riding - (If you brought bikes)
  5. Ball Games - Catch, kick, throw

Dad Projects (Build Together)

  1. Woodworking - Make something with Dad (with safety rules)
  2. 3D Printing - Design something on computer, watch it print
  3. Science Experiments - Safe and fun experiments
  4. Cooking Together - Help make dinner or dessert
  5. Garden Work - Plant something, water plants, dig in dirt

Screen Time (Limited)

  • Educational Games: 30 minutes max
  • Family Movie: Friday or Saturday night only
  • Video Chat: Call Mom if you miss her (any time!)

ğŸ˜° WHEN YOU FEEL SAD OR WORRIED

Itâ€™s Okay to Feel Big Feelings

Sometimes you might feel:

  • Sad about Mom and Dad
  • Worried about going back and forth
  • Mad about things changing
  • Scared of something
  • Justâ€¦ not okay

This is NORMAL. You are NOT in trouble for having feelings.

What to Do When You Feel Bad

  1. Find Dad - Tell him â€œI need helpâ€ or â€œI feel sadâ€
  2. Hug Time - Ask for a hug (as long as you want)
  3. Talk About It - Dad will listen (no judgment!)
  4. Quiet Space - Go to your room for alone time if you need it
  5. Comfort Item - Grab your stuffed animal, blanket, or favorite toy

Special Tools for Big Feelings

  • Breathing Ball - On your shelf, squeeze it when worried
  • Feelings Chart - Point to how you feel (on your wall)
  • Calm Down Corner - Beanbag chair with soft things
  • Call Mom - If you miss Mom, Dad will help you call

Magic Words

When youâ€™re upset, try saying:

  • â€œI need a breakâ€
  • â€œI need helpâ€
  • â€œI feel [sad/mad/scared]â€
  • â€œCan we talk?â€

Dad will ALWAYS stop and listen.

You are safe. Dad is here. Everything is okay.

ğŸ“ TALKING TO MOM

You Can Call Mom Any Time

  • Evening: Before bedtime if you miss her
  • Any Time: If you feel sad and need to hear her voice

How to Call

  1. Tell Dad â€œI want to call Momâ€
  2. Dad gets his phone
  3. You talk as long as you want
  4. Dad doesnâ€™t listen in (your private time)

If Mom Canâ€™t Answer

  • Dad will help you leave a voice message
  • You can text her (Dad helps you type)
  • You can draw a picture and Dad sends photo
  • She will call back when she can

Missing Mom is normal. Youâ€™re allowed to miss her.
